intro: Populus × canadensis var. robusta, commonly known as the American poplar, is a hybrid species native to North America. It is a large, fast-growing tree that can reach heights of up to 30 meters. The tree has heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5–10 centimeters in length, with a rough, hairy texture on the underside. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in catkins during the spring, followed by winged seeds dispersed by the wind. This species is often found in moist, well-drained soils along riverbanks and in open woodlands.
